verses.verse: When Balaam <WH1109> saw <WH7200> that it pleased <WH5869> Yahweh <WH3068> to bless <WH1288> Israel, <WH3478> he didn't <WH1980> go, as at the other times, <WH6471> to meet <WH7125> with enchantments, <WH5173> but he set <WH7896> his face <WH6440> toward the wilderness. <WH4057>
Balaam <WH1109> lifted up <WH5375> his eyes, <WH5869> and he saw <WH7200> Israel <WH3478> dwelling <WH7931> according to their tribes; <WH7626> and the Spirit <WH7307> of God came on him. <WH430>
He took up <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> "Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> says, <WH559> the man <WH1397> whose eye <WH5869> was closed <WH8365> says; <WH5002>

he says, <WH5002> who hears <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God, <WH410> who sees <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty, <WH7706> falling <WH5307> down, <WH5869> and having his eyes open: <WH1540>
How goodly <WH2895> are your tents, <WH168> Jacob, <WH3290> and your tents, <WH4908> Israel! <WH3478>

As valleys <WH5158> they are spread forth, <WH5186> as gardens <WH1593> by the riverside, <WH5104> as aloes <WH174> which Yahweh <WH3068> has planted, <WH5193> as cedar trees <WH730> beside the waters. <WH4325>

Water <WH4325> shall flow <WH5140> from <WH5140> his buckets. <WH1805> His seed <WH2233> shall be in many <WH7227> waters. <WH4325> His king <WH4428> shall be higher <WH7311> than Agag. <WH90> His kingdom <WH4438> shall be exalted. <WH5375>

God <WH410> brings him out <WH3318> of Egypt. <WH4714> He has as it were the strength <WH8443> of the wild ox. <WH7214> He shall eat up <WH398> the nations <WH1471> his adversaries, <WH6862> shall break <WH1633> their bones <WH6106> in pieces, <WH4272> and pierce them with his arrows. <WH2671>

He couched, <WH3766> he lay down <WH7901> as a lion, <WH738> as a lioness; <WH3833> who shall rouse him up? <WH6965> Everyone who blesses <WH1288> you is blessed. <WH1288> Everyone who curses you is cursed. <WH779>"

Balak <WH1111>'s anger <WH639> was kindled <WH2734> against Balaam, <WH1109> and he struck <WH5606> his hands <WH3709> together; <WH5606> and Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> to Balaam, <WH1109> "I called <WH7121> you to curse <WH6895> my enemies, <WH341> and, <WH1288> behold, you have altogether blessed <WH1288> them these three <WH7969> times. <WH6471>

Therefore now flee <WH1272> you to your place! <WH4725> I thought <WH559> to promote <WH3513> you to great <WH3513> honor; <WH3513> but, <WH3068> behold, Yahweh has kept you back <WH4513> from honor. <WH3519>"
Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> to Balak, <WH1111> "Didn't <WH1696> I also tell your messengers <WH4397> who you sent <WH7971> to me, <WH559> saying,

<WH1111> 'If Balak would give <WH5414> me his house <WH1004> full <WH4393> of silver <WH3701> and gold, <WH2091> I can't <WH3201> go beyond <WH5674> the word <WH6310> of Yahweh, <WH3068> to do <WH6213> either good <WH2896> or bad <WH7451> of my own mind. <WH3820> I will say <WH1696> what Yahweh <WH3068> says <WH1696>'?
Now, <WH1980> behold, I go to my people: <WH5971> come, <WH3212> I will inform <WH3289> you what this people <WH5971> shall do <WH6213> to your people <WH5971> in the latter <WH319> days. <WH3117>"
He took up <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> "Balaam <WH1109> the son <WH1121> of Beor <WH1160> says, <WH559> the man <WH1397> whose eye <WH5869> was closed <WH8365> says; <WH5002>

he says, <WH5002> who hears <WH8085> the words <WH561> of God, <WH410> knows <WH3045> the knowledge <WH1847> of the Most High, <WH5945> and who sees <WH2372> the vision <WH4236> of the Almighty, <WH7706> Falling <WH5307> down, <WH5869> and having his eyes open: <WH1540>

I see <WH7200> him, <WH7200> but not now. I see him, <WH7138> but not near. A star <WH3556> will come <WH1869> out of Jacob. <WH3290> A scepter <WH7626> will rise <WH6965> out of Israel, <WH3478> and shall strike <WH4272> through the corners <WH6285> of Moab, <WH4124> and break down <WH6979> all the sons <WH1121> of Sheth. <WH8352>
Edom <WH123> shall be a possession. <WH3424> Seir, <WH8165> his enemies, <WH341> also shall be a possession, <WH3424> while Israel <WH3478> does <WH6213> valiantly. <WH2428>
Out of Jacob <WH3290> shall one have dominion, <WH7287> and shall destroy <WH6> the remnant <WH8300> from the city. <WH5892>"

He looked <WH7200> at Amalek, <WH6002> and took up <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> "Amalek <WH6002> was the first <WH7225> of the nations, <WH1471> But his latter <WH319> end shall come <WH5703> to destruction. <WH8>"

He looked <WH7200> at the Kenite, <WH7017> and took up <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> "Your dwelling <WH4186> place is strong. <WH386> Your nest <WH7064> is set <WH7760> in the rock. <WH5553>
Nevertheless Kain <WH7014> shall <WH518> be wasted, <WH1197> until Asshur <WH804> carries you away captive. <WH7617>"
He took up <WH5375> his parable, <WH4912> and said, <WH559> "Alas, <WH188> who shall live <WH2421> when God <WH410> does this? <WH7760>

But ships <WH6716> shall come from the coast <WH3027> of Kittim. <WH3794> They shall afflict <WH6031> Asshur, <WH804> and shall afflict <WH6031> Eber. <WH5677> He also shall come <WH5703> to destruction. <WH8>"
Balaam <WH1109> rose up, <WH6965> and went <WH3212> and returned <WH7725> to his place; <WH4725> and Balak <WH1111> also went <WH1980> his way. <WH1870>
